ratings.comment: Great teacher, highly organized, really knew what he was doing.  Spent over three hours for office hours.  Was always available to meet outside of class.  Organized lectures, which he barely had to use notes on.  Very difficult homework.
Awesome professor, easily my favorite. Class was challenging but is to be expected from an honors level class. Worth the extra work!

Nagel is a great teacher. He is incredibly helpful during office hours and during class. His lectures are engaging and essential to attend. The honors math classes are very difficult, but he grades the homework and the tests very fairly. If you work hard you should get a good grade in the end.
I couldn't have passed this class without him!
Exams are not that bad, but the materials are getting tougher as the semester goes on, so do your best on each exam cuz there wont be a nice curve in this class.
great prof. crystal clear and hilarious whether he means to be or not. do the hw and go to lecture. all exam problems are just like the practice ones, but make sure you know the definitions.

Professor Nagel was an easy teacher.  The exams were really easy too.  He does expect you to know definitions, and you have to memorize a proof or two for the exam, but he usually makes it pretty clear which proof(s) it could be.

Great professor. Always made me laugh with his outfits. But he always made sure no one had any questions. Explained things several times. Reviewed material. Do the assigned problems (there are a lot) and pay attention in class and you will do fine on the exams (weighted). They are hard but do-able if you know the stuff.
Nagel is a great prof, he explains things very clearly and his exams were a very good representation of the material learned in class.

If you have the choice, take a class with this guy. He is the nicest man EVER and his exams are super easy, he doesn't try to pull anything crazy on exams. Lectures get a little dull because he goes over the same things in multiple lectures but you also cover less material because he wants to make sure everyone understands it completely
Prof. Nagel actually made me want to do math.  He explains things and you just get it.  Kind of a wierd feeling i think

Alex Nagel is not a professor: he's a teacher. He really cares about whether his students understand or not, and will take time to make sure you do. He's friendly and helpful. He's an expert, but he can explain anything to anyone.  He's just that good. Definitely let him take you under his wing whenever possible.

Amazing professor.  He managed to keep the majority of the class up to speed in a rather challenging class, and was always willing to go above and beyond to help students.  I would strongly recommend taking him if you have the chance.

Very good teacher. I would definately advise taking any class he teaches.  It seems like he has to answer everyone's questions in class and he tends to go off on tangents though. Still, a very good teacher who seems to enjoy what he does.
Prof Nagel. Is one of the finest professors at the UW. I had him many years ago for 722 he made the material clear and interesting.
Excellent professor, take any class you can that he teaches.

I had Nagel for the entire honors sequence.  It got easier as it went on but I think that's because we got better at math and not because the material is easy.  If you take him you will agree that he is one of the best professors on campus.  He really cares about his students too. Highly recommended. I have to get into his analysis class somehow...
Took both 375/376, somewhat difficult but wonderful teaching. Makes you work a bit, but you learn a lot in his class. I would recommend trying to get him.
nagel is the man.  Ask about the time he tried proving all horses were one color by induction.

I made the mistake of taking this class after only have Pre-Cal....don't make the same mistake.  Dispite what the course requirements say you really need to have prior Calculus experience.  Prof. Nagel is an amazing professor.  He's very friendly and approachable, and always makes extra time for you if you can't make his office hours.

Nagel is awesome.  He teaches a lot of interesting (but complicated) things that we don't really need to know, but the tests are fair.  I don't see how you can take this class without at least having taken calc AB in high school, but I suppose there are geniuses out there...

Professor Nagel is AMAZING; by far my favorite professor on campus.  He explains things clearly and has many office hour times for students who need additional help or just want to talk about Math.  He makes students laugh, but this class isn't a joke- prior Calculus experience is almost mandatory.  You won't regret taking a class with him!

I cannot speak highly enough of Prof. Nagel.  He has extreme knowledge of the subject and is very willing and able to help with any possible questions.  However, this is a hard course.  Consider a different course if you have not had calculus before.  However, the honors sequence is a must-have for any math major.
Very easy to understand and very helpful

Good at explaining complex proofs, willing to answer questions, friendly, likable. Your exams will not contain surprises--but they will require you to know the material. A fair class, grades are basically what you deserve. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
"Despite what you may have heard, continuous functions are BAD!"
Nagel does a great job of explaining the material and where it comes from. He's also good for a few interesting math facts once in a while. Great professor all in all.
He knows what he's doing but it's pretty dry.  What do you expect from a (hot) old white guy?:)  Exams are to be expected, he prepares you for them.  GET A GOOD TA.
If you have a problem with Calc, take Nagel. He will explain clearly, and repeatedly until you understand. wonderful Professor, best Calc teacher on Campus.

it's a hard class, but hey it's calculus. Nagel is very clear and friendly, and he encourages you to ask questions. really wants people to understand. I thought the class was hard but maybe that's just because I suck at math.
tons of useless examples, doesnt take enough time to useful examples. tests very hard.
Best professor in the mathematics department. Very accomodating to the needs of his students.
Nagel takes the time to explain things in detail. He's also a very likable and sweet guy.
Gotta love a professor who manages to get chalk all over his face!

Prof. Nagel is an extremely knowledgeable professor and has the uncanny ability to explain the most difficult calc. concepts so anyone can understand them.  If you take Math 221, make sure you get Prof. Nagel.
Sexy Voice. I also like his accent.  There are also a lot of funny looking people in his lectures. Take his class.
Best Calc professor on campus.
Always explains why things are the way they are.  I personally like that.  If you would rather have everything spoonfed to you, maybe you wouldn't like him.  I think he is great!
Top notch professor. One of the best at UW.
gives good clear lectures

This guy is so cool.  he gets chalk all over himself.  he always takes time to answer questions, and is willing to help on even the most basic problems (for calc 221).  a great guy, very clear, good explainer, generally awesome, really sexy
No Comments
Alex, you're hot.  I transferred from Columbia to be in your class.
No Comments
No Comments
